task_summary: The robot arm must locate, approach, and pick up the disk object from an open cubby on a shelving unit.

task_long_description.overview: A robot arm in a shared kitchen/lab environment is tasked to pick a disk object placed inside a bottom shelf cubby. The shelves also hold a white cube and a flower pot; the robot must avoid damaging surroundings. Perception ensures visibility/pose of the disk, followed by sequential approach, alignment, top-down grasp planning, and execution. Task completion is verified by confirming the disk is securely in the gripper.
preconditions: Disk located in lower right cubby of shelving unit.
Robot arm ready and gripper empty.
Scene is unobstructed and sufficiently illuminated.
No other object blocks direct access to disk.
stepwise_plan: Check if disk is visible; if not, scan the shelf region to find it.
Detect and localize disk with a pose estimate.
Open the gripper to adequate width for disk.
Move the gripper above the disk, using a safe height.
Compute a top-down grasp pose for the disk.
Approach and align the end-effector precisely with the disk pose.
Verify disk is held by the gripper.
success_criteria: Disk is securely held in the gripper.
No collision or displacement of other objects.
No shelf damage; arm retreats safely after grasp.
failure_and_recovery: Disk not detected: retry scan up to 3 times.
Grasp pose not computed: abort and log failure.
No object in gripper after grasp: stop and alert operator.
Unexpected contact: halt motion and retry or abort.
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates on confirmed disk-in-gripper or unrecoverable failure (e.g. disk lost, timeout).

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if disk is visible by the robot's sensors.
Performs a raster scan to locate disk if not currently visible.
Detect and localize the disk using perception.
Opens the gripper to 6cm to prepare for grasp.
Moves the gripper to a position 5cm above the disk.
Computes a top-down grasp pose for the disk and stores it in key 'std_top'.
Approaches and aligns end-effector with the disk with 5mm tolerance.
Executes grasp at the planned top-down pose.
Checks that the disk is now held in the gripper.

failure_modes: Disk not found due to occlusion or scene mislocalization.
Disk displaced or dropped during approach/grasp.
recovery_strategy: Retry scan up to 3 times if disk not immediately visible.
Abort if stable grasp cannot be confirmed.
Alert operator in case of unrecoverable failure.
assumptions: Assuming the disk is the round, flat white object at the bottom right cubby as visible in frames 2-7.
No explicit force or special constraints were given in the instruction.
Instruction is generic; BT design strictly follows visual steps from frames.

expected_success_criteria: Robot confirms disk in gripper after execution.
No disturbance to the shelf or neighboring objects.
